Medicine_282_r$Medicine_228_r$Medicine_7.text:
Finding A: Although the light of the half moon would likely be sufficient to illuminate the pollen, the full moon alone remains up throughout the entire night, so the researchers think that E. foeminiea maximizes the effect for efficiency.
Finding B: In other words, it isn\'t testosterone levels that predict muscle gains, but how sensitive your muscles are to that testosterone.
Finding C: The best predictor of poor quality was the nurse practice environment.
Finding D: They showed bumblebee queens were far less active and six times more likely to die during sustained exposure (37 days) to the pesticide, which could be somewhat mitigated by a shorter exposure of 17 days.

Finding A: Although the light of the half moon would likely be sufficient to illuminate the pollen, the full moon alone remains up throughout the entire night, so the researchers think that E. foeminiea maximizes the effect for efficiency.

Finding D: They showed bumblebee queens were far less active and six times more likely to die during sustained exposure (37 days) to the pesticide, which could be somewhat mitigated by a shorter exposure of 17 days.

test_question_testing_B.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and B for most sensational.

Medicine_214_p$Medicine_138_r$Medicine_9.text:
Finding A: We do not endorse the need for universal screening with androgen assays or ultrasound if patients already meet two of the three criteria clinically.
Finding B: A Genetic Risk for Big Appetites The importance of catching these signs could become greater if the child is already genetically predisposed to a large appetite.
Finding C: In aggregate, the bifidobacterial species distribution did not differ greatly between secretor-fed infants and non-secretor-fed infants.
Finding D: SPINART 3 year randomised study Tertiary Prophy vs On demand in adults with #haemophilia. With prophy 94% less bleeds. 1/3 no bleeds at all, 3/4 <2 bleeds per year. Higher quality of life. No change in MRI - bony changes are irreversible. #hemophilia

Finding D: SPINART 3 year randomised study Tertiary Prophy vs On demand in adults with #haemophilia. With prophy 94% less bleeds. 1/3 no bleeds at all, 3/4 <2 bleeds per year. Higher quality of life. No change in MRI - bony changes are irreversible. #hemophilia

Medicine_30_r$Medicine_217_p$Medicine_43.text:
Finding A: With a daily aspirin, 57 rather than 61 people per 10,000 would be expected to suffer a heart attack or stroke; at the same time, 23 rather than 16 people per 10,000 would experience severe bleeding, on average.
Finding B: The incidence rate of type 1 diabetes was lower in the non-EV than the EV group (4 vs 6 per 100,000 person-years; incidence rate ratio 1.48 [95% CI 1.19, 1.83]) ( Table 2 ).
Finding C: Cuteness helps babies survive.
Finding D: Distance between ponds and various landscape features could not fully explain the observed genetic differences.

Medicine_tweet_244_p$Medicine_tweet_143_.text:
Finding A: We estimated that each 1% reduction in real public health expenditure per-capita corresponded to a 0.5 percentage points reduction in MMR coverage.
Finding B: Pretty convincing evidence of negative selection detectable in cancer exomes in contrast to Martincorena et al Cell 2017. Nice eg in TERT w +ve selection in promoter but -ve selection in exons. Makes good sense!
Finding C: Our new paper shows link between cuts to public health budgets and falling vaccination rates in Italy \n
Finding D: This suggests that amygdala neurons encode whole-face information and emotion independently.

Medicine_tweet_22_p$Medicine_430_p$Medic.text:
Finding A: The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA in adults aged 50 years and over was 16.7% (95% CI 15.3% to 18.0%).
Finding B: Cohort effects were also observed for some subgroups, particularly in $7 hours of sleep for male subjects, white subjects, and those in urban areas; those in the earliest cohorts, as well as cohorts born in the early 1990s, were more likely to report regular $7 hours of sleep compared with all other adolescents.
Finding C: Salt increased the microbe-killing capacity of the immune cells, the team reports; the macrophages exposed to high levels of sodium chloride released significantly more microbicidal molecules than those that grew in a culture medium without salt.
Finding D: This finding suggested that motility is possibly strong enough to modulate the force imposed on load-bearing bonds and drive active bacterial migration over endothelia under PCV shear stress.
Medicine_tweet_22_p$Medicine_430_p$Medic.displayed_text:
Finding A: The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA in adults aged 50 years and over was 16.7% (95% CI 15.3% to 18.0%).
Finding B: Cohort effects were also observed for some subgroups, particularly in $7 hours of sleep for male subjects, white subjects, and those in urban areas; those in the earliest cohorts, as well as cohorts born in the early 1990s, were more likely to report regular $7 hours of sleep compared with all other adolescents.
Finding C: Salt increased the microbe-killing capacity of the immune cells, the team reports; the macrophages exposed to high levels of sodium chloride released significantly more microbicidal molecules than those that grew in a culture medium without salt.
Finding D: This finding suggested that motility is possibly strong enough to modulate the force imposed on load-bearing bonds and drive active bacterial migration over endothelia under PCV shear stress.

Medicine_112_r$Medicine_94_r$Medicine_17.text:
Finding A: "This is the first study to explicitly show the amount of fundamental infrastructure potentially at risk across the Northern Hemisphere permafrost area under climate change," Hjort and his colleagues wrote in the paper.
Finding B: They found that while it was associated with a lower risk of heart attacks and other cardiovascular events, it did lead to an increased risk of major bleeding.
Finding C: Therefore, both cervical cancer incidence and expenditure can be substantially reduced if the states coordinate policies to promote expansion of coverage, particularly for the new nonavalent vaccine.
Finding D: In this study, not one child met strict diagnostic criteria for ASD using results of both the ADOS and SCQ.

Medicine_405_r$Medicine_tweet_69_p$Medic.text:
Finding A: The results showed that gamblers demonstrated more probability matching behavior and are thus obviously more likely to perceive illusory patterns.
Finding B: In addition to modifying the shape, dolphin whistles were also higher frequency during increased broadband and 2.5 kHz TOL ambient noise immediately prior to the call.
Finding C: The regulation of energy metabolism by Ago2 provides a novel paradigm in which RNA silencing plays an integral role in determining basal metabolic activity in obesity-associated sequelae.
Finding D: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes

Medicine_263_r$Medicine_tweet_164_p$Medi.text:
Finding A: This could be the reason why genetically identical viruses can be found in very different environments in the planet.
Finding B: We show that jellyfish exhibit a unique mechanism of passive energy recapture, which is exploited to allow them to travel 30% further each swimming cycle, thereby reducing metabolic energy demand by swimming muscles.
Finding C: This pore architecture suggests a conduction pathway involving transitions between two main states with one or two hydrated Ca 21 ions bound in the selectivity filter and supports a \'knock-off\' mechanism of ion permeation through a stepwisebinding process.
Finding D: The current study is the first to demonstrate that HS students are using e-cigarettes to vaporize cannabis.

Medicine_3_p$Medicine_tweet_79_p$Medicin.text:
Finding A: Most (n = 427 [60.6%]) of the 704 patients undergoing day surgery reported sufficient FHL, 223 (31.7%) reported problematic FHL, and 54 (7.7%) reported inadequate FHL.
Finding B: In women, life expectancy at age 40 years increased 5.4 years (from 37.4 to 42.7 years), but without tobacco control, it would have been projected to increase by only 3.8 years (from 37.3 to 41.2 years).
Finding C: Therefore, both cervical cancer incidence and expenditure can be substantially reduced if the states coordinate policies to promote expansion of coverage, particularly for the new nonavalent vaccine.
Finding D: Given evidence for more pronounced MSDP-offspring smoking links in daughters (12-14, 16,17,19,24) and for sex differences in prenatal glucocorticoid levels (59) and offspring outcomes after prenatal glucocorticoid exposure (60), we also hypothesized that links between prenatal glucocorticoids and offspring ND would be stronger for daughters.
Medicine_3_p$Medicine_tweet_79_p$Medicin.displayed_text:
Finding A: Most (n = 427 [60.6%]) of the 704 patients undergoing day surgery reported sufficient FHL, 223 (31.7%) reported problematic FHL, and 54 (7.7%) reported inadequate FHL.
Finding B: In women, life expectancy at age 40 years increased 5.4 years (from 37.4 to 42.7 years), but without tobacco control, it would have been projected to increase by only 3.8 years (from 37.3 to 41.2 years).
Finding C: Therefore, both cervical cancer incidence and expenditure can be substantially reduced if the states coordinate policies to promote expansion of coverage, particularly for the new nonavalent vaccine.
Finding D: Given evidence for more pronounced MSDP-offspring smoking links in daughters (12-14, 16,17,19,24) and for sex differences in prenatal glucocorticoid levels (59) and offspring outcomes after prenatal glucocorticoid exposure (60), we also hypothesized that links between prenatal glucocorticoids and offspring ND would be stronger for daughters.

Medicine_tweet_161_p$Medicine_tweet_73_p.text:
Finding A: The finding that mothers of children with obesity used more direct imperatives to restrict eating may have important implications for practice guidelines and future research.
Finding B: In our study, higher ANO7 mRNA expression strongly correlated with poor overall survival in PrCa patients.
Finding C: Sound-meaning association biases evidenced across thousands of languages.
Finding D: Lastly, a tumor could be established in the egg using tumor samples from ovarian cancer patients and that our nanoparticles were effective in eliminating the tumor.

Finding A: The finding that mothers of children with obesity used more direct imperatives to restrict eating may have important implications for practice guidelines and future research.
Finding B: In our study, higher ANO7 mRNA expression strongly correlated with poor overall survival in PrCa patients.
Finding C: Sound-meaning association biases evidenced across thousands of languages.
Finding D: Lastly, a tumor could be established in the egg using tumor samples from ovarian cancer patients and that our nanoparticles were effective in eliminating the tumor.
